starling.runner.replayer.Replayer¶

class starling.runner.replayer.Replayer(environment_path, environment_log_path, reward_log_path, action_log_path)[source]¶

Bases: starling.runner.stepper.Stepper

Class for replaying a simulation from disk log files.

__init__(environment_path, environment_log_path, reward_log_path, action_log_path)[source]¶

Construct a Replayer instance.

Parameters

  • environment_path (String) – Path where initial environment file (which initialised the simulation) was saved

  • environment_log_path (String) – Path of environment log from simulation

  • reward_log_path (String) – Path of rewards log from simulation

  • action_log_path (String) – Path of actions log from simulation

Methods

Logs current environment actions to internal class dictionaries and to external .csv files.

Logs current environment data to internal class dictionaries and to external .csv files.

Logs the metadata to internal memory and csv

Logs current reward to internal class dictionaries and to external .csv files.

Writes the internal logs to .json files

next_trajectory(actions)

Uses the simulator (predictor) to calculate new trajectories and moves aircraft on these trajectories.

plot_history([istep, new_axes])

Plot 2D aircraft trajectories starting from a given step in the simulation (istep) or from the current step if istep=None.

plot_history_complete([istep, new_axes])

Plot 2D aircraft trajectories and flight level starting from a given step in the simulation (istep) or from the current step if istep=None.

render([mode])

Visualise the environment

Replays the simulation visualisation, skipping the first burnin steps.

plot_history_complete(istep=None, new_axes=False)¶

Plot 2D aircraft trajectories and flight level starting from a given step in the simulation (istep) or from the current step if istep=None.

render(mode='history')¶

Visualise the environment

replay(burnin=0, mode='history')[source]¶

Replays the simulation visualisation, skipping the first burnin steps. When mode is set to ‘history’, a 2D viosualisation is produced. When mode is set to ‘history_complete’ a richer 3D visualisation is produced.

reset()¶

Reset internal variables
